"J. B. Rainsberger" wrote:

> On 1/11/2002 at 11:05 AM Magnus ?or Torfason wrote:
>
>      Does anyone know of a way to compare two XML files so that
>      only the XML
>      semantics are compared, not the underlying strings?
>
> If that doesn't work, then you should be able to write a simple
> recursive algorithm that does the equals comparison the way you'd
> want. Something like "XmlUtil.assertXmlDocumentsEquals()" which takes
> two root Node objects and walks the respective trees. I'm not sure how
> complex that would be.

I haven't tried this specifically on XML documents, but I have tried it
on a tree of nodes.  A TreeAssert class walks the expected and actual
trees using a breadth-first search and calls the assertNodeEquals() for
each node visited.  It's relatively simple.

You might also try XmlUnit (http://xmlunit.sourceforge.net/), which
appears to support some form of comparisons between XML documents.

Mike
